channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Get your foot in the door! UK/EU Remote Jr. Perl Developer
item.description: We know that a lack of commercial experience doesn’t always reflect skill level, know-how, or programming brilliance. You know your stuff. You’re keen to grow and learn. You know that if someone would only just give you a chance, and let you in the door, you could really shine!

item.title: Cruise into this Dreamy Career. Perl role in Malta
item.description: Our client is an international company who pride themselves on making online trading a breeze. After twenty-plus years cruising the financial waters, they’re subject matter experts who provide a stable, engaging environment for their crew. Located in glorious Malta, they offer a supportive team that believes in open communication and solving problems together.

item.title: Can’t find the right job? Build your own! Remote Perl role in Australia
item.description: Have you ever seen those build-a-bear kiosks in the mall? You choose the components and watch your furry friend take shape. Now imagine a kiosk where you’re building your perfect job, because that’s exactly what our latest role offers!

item.title: Make a Difference AND a Paycheque. 100% remote (within the UK) Mid-level Perl developer role
item.description: Perl programmers, this one’s for you. If you’ve got experience with Python, so much the better, but Perl is a must-have for this role. You’ll be a whiz with databases like PostgreSQL and MySQL, and you’ll write tidy, easily-maintained HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Great CPAN modules released last week;

item.title: Variable ... will not stay shared ...
item.description: What does this warning mean and how to avoid it?

item.title: Weekly Challenge 143
item.description: A real calculator in Perl using regex. Nice to keep it as reference. Well done.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge 143: Stealthy Calculator
item.description: Roger shared Kotlin solution with us for the first time. There is so much to learn every week from him. Great to have you in the team.

item.title: Stealthy Number Test •
item.description: Welcome back Mark after a long gap. Thanks for short and sweet blog.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 143
item.description: Great example showing the power of regex and one liner in Perl. Thanks for sharing your knowledge with us.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 143: stealthing the grammars!
item.description: PostgreSQL solution is worth checking. It is one my favourite database, I am impressed how Luca solving the weekly tasks in PostgreSQL.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 143: Calculator and Stealthy Numbers
item.description: Laurent's shared the power of EVAL and its issues. Nice blog for anyone new to Raku. Keep it up great work.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge #143
item.description: No one can bear James in writing beautiful Perl code. I wish I could. Thanks for sharing compact solutions.

item.title: PWC143 - Stealthy Number
item.description: Looking at the quality Raku solutions, I feel like start contributing in Raku again. Thanks for the motivation.

item.title: PWC143 - Calculator
item.description: Another cool example of Raku Grammar. Well organised blog, worth keeping it bookmarked. Thanks for sharing.

item.title: Ninja Numbers Hiding In Trees: The Weekly Challenge #143
item.description: A complete solution in Perl using the power of regex. I loved the story. Great work, keep it up.

item.title: Stealthy Calculator with Raku and Perl
item.description: Brilliant piece of work to showcase the power of EVAL and Raku Grammar. Thanks for your contributions.

item.title: Stealthy Calculations
item.description: What a treat, a complete Parser for Calculator task. You don't want to skip it. Keep it up great work.

item.title: Perl Review - Perl Weekly Challenge - 139
item.description: Perl Solutions Review by Colin Crain.

item.title: Perl Review - Perl Weekly Challenge - 138
item.description: Perl Solutions Review by Colin Crain.

item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 143
item.description: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Calculator" and "Stealthy Number" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 144
item.description: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Semiprime" and "Ulam Sequence". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.

item.title: Larry Wall website???
item.description: The author ask when will Larry Wall update his website and I think the response is great: 'Why would you update a masterpiece like that?'

item.title: My Favorite Warnings: syntax
item.description: Warnings category syntax contains a number of sub-categories representing possibly-problematic syntax. These include ambiguous syntax, problematic bareword usage, invalid printf conversions, and more.

item.title: A (not so) simple matter of privacy
item.description: With lots of discussion.

AoC 2021/11 - Calm Dumbo Octopuses
item.description: On with Advent of Code puzzle 11 from 2021: taking it with calm.

item.title: AoC 2021/10 - Syntax scoring
item.description: Playing with parentheses.

item.title: A brief note on Log4perl
item.description: Does the vulnaribility in the Java package impact the similarly named package in Perl?

item.title: Advent of Code Day 9 to 14
item.description: https://domm.plix.at/perl/2021_aoc_day_09_to_14.html

item.title: Advent Of Code 2021, Day 1: Sonar Sweep
item.description: The first part of the Advent series of Abigail. You can edit the URL to see the rest of the posts. The source of the posts are available on GitHub.

item.title: AoC 2021/09 - Flood fill
item.description: The Advent of Code puzzle 9 from 2021: using the flood fill algorithm.

item.title: GNU timeout annoyed me so I replaced it; or an extremely simple introduction to fork() and signal handling in perl
item.description: One of the problems CPAN testers are facing is code that hangs. That just sits there waiting for Godot.

item.title: #543 - Happy Birthday!
item.description:
Hi there!

Thomas Klausner sent me a bunch of links and suggestion, let me share them first:

Abigail has a series of Advent post starting from day 01. I did not find a page listing all the entries but you can get to them by changing the URL. Smylers is doing crazy stuff with vim (and perl). One can find a lot of inspiring code (Perl, Raku and of course other languages) in the various 'Solution Megathreads' on Reddit. Finally domm himself has a few Advent related posts.

Today we are celebrating the 80th birthday of my mother. Due to the pandemic we cannot celebrate in the same space, but we have collected some videos from the family members and her friends and we are going to have a Zoom session. Much better than not being able to celebrate at all. Happy birthday mom!

In a few days a large part of the world is going to celebrate the birthday of another Jew.

Merry Christmas!
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
